threat_actor_profile.operational_pattern: Coordinated multi-person operation with defined roles

initial_contact.social_engineering: Professional business approach with investment opportunity

techniques: Coordinated team effort appearing as legitimate company

investment_phase.investment_narrative: Crypto asset investment with company analysts' guidance

additional_fees_requested.justification: Required to unfreeze account and access funds

exit_strategy.method: Platform shutdown after victim refused additional fees

phone_numbers.purpose: Used by 'Leonid' and analysts to contact victim
phone_numbers.details: Specific number(s) not provided in narrative

social_engineering_tactics: Phone-based cold calling or targeted outreach
Fee demand to access own funds
red_flags: Unsolicited phone call about investment opportunity
Multiple company representatives all pushing same platform
Big profit promises with low risk
Multiple domains for same company (redundancy suggests temporary)
Blockchain commissions fee (not a real thing)
Cannot deduct fee from existing balance
Must pay new funds to access own money
Website shut down after fee refusal

timeline.initial_contact: Not specified - phone call from Leonid
timeline.analyst_contacts: Not specified - various analysts reached out after Leonid
timeline.platform_shutdown: After victim refused to pay fees (current status: offline)

defensive_recommendations: Be highly skeptical of unsolicited investment phone calls
Research investment companies through regulatory databases (SEC, FINRA, FinCEN)
Verify company legitimacy through official channels, not provided contact info
Question why legitimate investment company would cold-call strangers
Be wary when multiple company representatives all push same opportunity
Understand that blockchain transactions have network fees, not percentage commissions
Never pay fees to access your own funds
Recognize account freezing as manipulation tactic
Always test withdrawals with small amounts before large deposits
Check domain registration age and details
Verify company physical address and regulatory licensing
Be suspicious of guaranteed or 'big' profit promises
Get second opinions from independent financial advisors
Understand legitimate platforms deduct fees from balance, don't require new payments

initial_access.description: Person named Leonid called victim about investment opportunity with Seikum

techniques.name: Professional Company Impersonation
techniques.description: Presented Seikum as legitimate crypto asset company with multiple employees

techniques.name: Multi-Person Coordination
techniques.description: Leonid made initial contact, then various 'analysts' followed up with proposals

techniques.name: Formal Documentation
techniques.description: Provided investment proposals and contracts to appear legitimate

techniques.name: Fake Profit Display
techniques.description: Showed balance growing from $3,000 to over $10,000

techniques.name: Technical Intimidation
techniques.description: Used 'blockchain commissions' terminology to justify fee

websites.sophistication: High - functional trading, account system, finance tracking

communication.purpose: Initial contact and ongoing communication with victim

persistence.technique: Fake profit display and multiple team members maintaining engagement
persistence.description: Showed growing balance and had various analysts continue engagement to maintain victim interest

techniques: Platform shutdown after failed additional extraction
Team-based approach makes investigation more complex

defense_evasion: T1070.004 - Indicator Removal on Host (Website shutdown)
T1027 - Obfuscated Files or Information (Technical jargon)
collection: T1530 - Data from Cloud Storage Object (Cryptocurrency deposits)
impact: T1499 - Endpoint Denial of Service (Account freeze, platform shutdown)

metadata.analyst_notes: Sophisticated multi-person operation combining phone-based fraud with crypto platform scam. Notable for phone-based initial contact (unusual for pig butchering). Team coordination with Leonid and various 'analysts' creates professional company appearance. Formal contracts and proposals add legitimacy. Blockchain commissions fee is fake concept designed to extract additional funds. Victim showed good judgment refusing to pay additional $2,500. Multi-domain infrastructure indicates organized operation with resources.
